summary: Romantic interactive Valentine’s page; user wants the “No” button to be more playful with added playful messages, and also wants a shorter/custom share URL containing the phrase “mujhe to tu psnd hai”.

existing_features.title: Expand and improve the rotating text/messages shown on the “No” button so it cycles through a larger set of playful, interesting, Valentine-themed excuses written in English.

Make the “No” button’s interaction behavior more playful than the current simple random reposition + bounce by adding additional playful motion/feedback effects during interaction (e.g., wiggle/spin/squish, feint movement, or other fun micro-interactions) while keeping the “Yes” button easy to click.
Ensure the “No” button’s movement stays within the visible viewport on common screen sizes (mobile and desktop) so it doesn’t jump off-screen or under the browser UI.
Add support for a shareable URL variant that includes the exact phrase “mujhe to tu psnd hai” in the URL (as a URL-safe slug), so the Valentine page renders correctly when opened via that URL.
Expose the custom share URL in the UI so the user can copy/share it easily.

new_feature_requests.summary: Make the “No” button more playful and add interesting playful messages
Provide a shorter/custom share URL that includes the phrase “mujhe to tu psnd hai”.

projectName: Make the “No” button more playful with more playful messages
